meanings.definition: To straighten out or remove kinks from (something)
meanings.sent1: She carefully unkinked the tangled necklace.
meanings.sent2: He used a comb to unkink his hair after swimming.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved unkinking a chain in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to unkink even the most stubborn frowns.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor taught us how to unkink our muscles after a workout.

meanings.definition: To make (something) less tangled or twisted
meanings.sent1: After hours of work, she finally managed to unkink the garden hose.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully unkinked the fabric before sewing it.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to unkink the yarn ball but only made it worse.
meanings.sent4: His words had a way of unkinking complicated situations.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze helped to unkink the sails of the boat.
